text.text:
You can download the AppMeasurement software from the Code Manager.

Symbian Device Library

The following files are required to use the AppMeasurement library on Symbian devices:

AppMeasurement.h: The Symbian C++ header file. This file can be placed in your project folder.

AppMeasurement.lib: Library designed for use on the Symbian device. Use this library for development and testing directly on the device, and include it with your shipping application. During development we recommend placing this file in the C:\QtSDK\Symbian\SDKs\Symbian1Qt463\epoc32\release\armv5\urel folder.

Symbian Emulator Library

When testing development using the Symbian Library, use the following file in place of the AppMeasurement.lib file:

LibAppMeasurement.a: Library designed for use with the Windows* Symbian emulator. Use this library while developing your Symbian application. This file can be placed in your project folder.

Development Tools

The following tools and versions were used to develop the AppMeasurement Libraries for Symbian:

  • 4.6.3 framework
  • Latest available version of QtCreator
About Multi-Threaded Applications

AppMeasurement for Symbian is not thread-safe. You can use it in a multi-threaded application, but you cannot access it from multiple threads.

A sample QtCreator project that implements the AppMeasurement Libraries for Symbian is available for download using the following link:

SampleApp.zip

Download and extract this project. The folder you select cannot contain any spaces in the entire path. After the sample project is extracted, complete the following steps to configure the application.

  • Copy the AppMeasurement.lib file from Code Manager to the libraries folder on your development workstation:

    C:\QtSDK\Symbian\SDKs\Symbian1Qt463\epoc32\release\armv5\urel

  • Copy AppMeasurement.h and LibAppMeasurement.a from Code Manager to a folder in your project. For example, the SampleApp folder.
  • Right-click your project in QtCreator and select Add existing file. Browse to the AppMeasurement.h file and add it to your project.
  • Add the LibAppMeasurement.a file to your project using the process in the previous step.
  • Update the following:
    • In SampleApp.pro, update symbian:TARGET.UID3 with your UID3 value.
    • In main.cpp, update s.account and s.evar1 with your account and any values you want to track.
  • Right-click your project and run qmake.

  • Compile and run the application. You should see the hit that is sent by the track call in main.cpp in the QtCreator Application Output window.

Variable Description
account

Syntax:

s.account="mycompanycom";

(required) The report suite or report suites (multi-suite tagging) that you want to track.

dc

Syntax:

s.dc="d1"; or "d2";

Identifies the Adobe data center. Do not change this value unless so instructed by your Adobe Account Manager.

d1 = San Jose data center

d2 = Dallas data center

For reference, the dc variable is also specified in your Web site’s core JavaScript file (s_code.js).

linkTrackEvents

Syntax:

s.linkTrackEvents="purchase,event1";

A comma-separated list of events that restricts the current set of events for link tracking.

If s.linkTrackEvents is not defined, AppMeasurement for iOS sends all events.

For example: s.linkTrackEvents = @"purchase,event1";

linkTrackVars

Syntax:

s.linkTrackVars= "events,prop1,eVar49";

A comma-separated list of variable names that restricts the current set of variables for link tracking.

If s.linkTrackVars is not defined, AppMeasurement for Symbian sends all variables with values. Even though pageName is sent, the Page View count does not increment.

trackingServertrackingServerSecure

Syntax:

s.trackingServer = "metrics.mycompany.com"; s.trackingServerSecure = "smetrics.mycompany.com";

Identifies the collection domain when you are using a first-party cookie implementation. These values should match the collection domain in your s_code.js file, if one exists.

If you want to use these variables, you must set them both. You cannot set only one tracking server variable.

userAgent

This variable is not used in this beta release.

Syntax:

s.userAgent = "

The HTTP User-Agent field that is sent with each track call to Adobe data collection servers.

By default, AppMeasurement for Symbian sets a default value for this variable that includes Symbian device information and application name and version. If necessary, you can append additional information to this default value. For example:

visitorNamespace

Syntax:

s.visitorNamespace="mycompany";

Must match the visitorNamespace used in your JavaScript tracking file (s_code.js). If your JavaScript file does not have a visitorNamespace variable defined, do not define it in the AppMeasurement DLL. Using the wrong value for visitorNamespace causes incorrect reporting.

currencyCode

Syntax:

s.currencyCode="USD";

Specifies the currency code that Adobe uses to denominate purchases or currency events collected in the application or website.

visitorID

Syntax:

s.visitorID = "12345";

Unique identifier for each visitor. Defaults to the device IMEI.

PageName or PageURL

Syntax:

s.pageName="Some Page Name"; s.pageURL="http://www.myurl.com";

Specify pageName so that ClickMap can properly overlay data.

If users do not access the application through a Web browser, specify a pageURL as well. If users access the application through a Web browser, leave pageURL blank and AppMeasurement automatically sets pageURL to the Web browser’s URL.

linkLeaveQueryString

This variable is not used in this beta release.

Syntax:

s.linkLeaveQueryString = true;

Determines whether the query string should be included in the Exit Links and File Download reports. By default, marketing reports exclude query strings from all reports. However, for some Exit Links and File Download reports, the important portion of the URL might be in the query string.

For example, the download file name might be defined in the query string, making the query string necessary for an accurate File Downloads report.

Enables or disables preserving the query-string on the URL for links to Web pages from within the iOS application. By default, this variable is false.

You cannot override this variable using variable overrides.

If query strings contain session IDs or other personally identifiable information, contact your Account Manager to have reporting strip out those query string elements.

ssl

This variable is not used in this beta release. All hits are sent using HTTP.

Syntax:

s.ssl = true;

Enables or disables sending measurement data via SSL (HTTPS). By default, this variable is NO.

You cannot override this variable using variable overrides.

debugTracking

Syntax:

s.debugTracking = true;

Lets you view debug information in your platform’s debugger. For example, stdout and the QtCreator Application Output Window.

usePlugins

Syntax:

s.usePlugins = true; MyDelegate md; s.delegate = &md;

Enables or disables using plug-ins as part of a delegate implementation. By default, this variable is false. See .

You cannot override this variable using variable overrides.

Page view tracking (track) and link tracking (trackLink) sends all variables that have values (non-NULL, non-empty). You should reset or empty all variables, as needed, before calling track or trackLink.

Method Description
track

Syntax:

//standard call using default values s.track(); //track passing in a map object to provide temporary variable overrides map myMap; myMap["evar1"] = "new_evar1_value"; myMap["evar74"] = "new_evar74_value"; map *ptr_map = &myMap; s.track(ptr_map * variableOverrides = NULL);

Sends a standard page view to Adobe data collection servers, along with any Track Config Variables that have values.

trackLink

Syntax:

s.trackLink( string const & url, string const & type, string const & name,map * variableOverrides = NULL );

Sends custom, download or exit link data to Adobe data collection servers, along with any track config variables that have values. Use trackLink to track all activity that should not capture a page view. trackLink has the following parameters:

url: Identifies the clicked URL. If no URL is specified, the name is used. Use this only when linking to a Web page from within your iOS application. Otherwise, pass in nil for this parameter.

type: Identifies the link report that will display the URL or name. Supported values include:

  • “o” (Custom Links)
  • “d” (File Downloads)
  • “e” (Exit Links)

name: The name that appears in the link report. If no name is specified, the report uses the URL.

variable overrides: optional map of temporary variable overrides.

To collect data, you must specify either the name or url parameter. When not using one of these parameters, pass in an empty string "" as the value.

(Instance instantiation) Declare Instance

Declare instance as either a class variable (in class header file), or a global/static variable.

AppMeasurement & s = AppMeasurement::instance();
(Instance instantiation) Instantiate Instance and Setup Account Configuration VariablesAppMeasurement & s = AppMeasurement::instance(); s.account = "rsid"; s.evar1 = "evar1_value"; s.track();
Send a Page Views.PageName = "some page name"; //clear other variables s.channel = ""; s.prop1 = ""; s.track();

Send a Custom Links.channel = "some channel"; s.trackLink("", "o", "some action name");
Send a Download Links.prop1 = "some prop"; s.trackLink("http://somedownloadurl.com", "d", "some action name");
Send a Custom Link with Variable Overrides //create a map that contains your variable overrides map myMap; myMap["evar1"] = "new_evar1_value"; myMap["evar74"] = "new_evar74_value"; map *ptr_map = &myMap; s.trackLink("myURL", "d", "myName", ptr_map);
Plug-in Example

AppMeasurement for Symbian supports a plug-in architecture that lets you build custom plug-ins that extend AppMeasurement for Symbian functionality. Use this functionality to modify the AppMeasurement for iOS object to manipulate data before sending it to Adobe data collection servers. AppMeasurement & s = AppMeasurement::instance(); s.delegate = this; s.ssl = true; s.usePlugins = true; s.account = "myreportsuiteid"; s.pageName = "Main View"; s.track(); // After instantiating the object, have your delegate object implement the AppMeasurementDelegate protocol class MyClass : public AppMeasurementDelegate { ... }; void MyClass :: doPlugin(AppMeasurement const *s) { // custom code s.prop4 = @"plugin"; };
